member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor that creates an empty instance.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.#ctor(char,char)
member.summary: Creates an XML tree with a given node as a root.
member.param: Name of the node that will be a root.
Optional arguments to the root node. If provided, they should be in this form:arg1=\"value1\" arg2=\"value2\" … If values do not contain spaces, escaped quotes can be omitted.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.#ctor(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Xml})
member.summary: Constructor. Creates a path out of the specified XML file.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setArg(char,char)
member.summary: Sets a literal value of a given argument.
member.returns: true if the argument is set successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getArg(char) const
member.summary: Gets an XML argument.
member.returns: Value of the argument, if it is found; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.isArg(char) const
member.summary: Checks whether an argument with a given name exists.
member.returns: true if the argument exists; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setArgName(int,char)
member.summary: Sets the XML argument name.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getArgName(int) const
member.summary: Returns argument name by its number.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setArgValue(int,char)
member.summary: Sets the XML argument value.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getArgValue(int) const
member.summary: Returns the XML argument value.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setBoolArg(char,bool)
member.summary: Sets a value of a given boolean argument.
member.param: Value of the argument. Any non-zero value means true, the zero value means false.
member.returns: true if the operation was successful; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getBoolArg(char,bool) const
member.summary: Returns a value of a given boolean argument. To check, if an argument exists, use the isArg() method.
member.returns: 1 if the argument has a value 1, true or TRUE; 0, if the argument has a value 0, false or FALSE; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getBoolArg(char) const
member.summary: Returns a value of a given boolean argument. To check, if an argument exists, use the isArg() method.
member.returns: 1 if the argument has a value 1, true or TRUE; 0, if the argument has a value 0, false or FALSE; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setBoolData(bool)
member.summary: Sets a boolean content for the node. This can be done only for nodes with no children.
member.param: Content to set. Any non-zero value means true, the zero value means false.
member.returns: 1 if the content is set successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getBoolData const
member.summary: Returns a boolean interpretation of data stored in the node.
member.returns: 1 if a value equals to 1, true or TRUE; 0, if the value equals to 0, false or FALSE; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getChild(char) const
member.summary: Returns the child of the XML tree.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getChild(int) const
member.summary: Returns a child node by its name or index number in the child list. To check, if a child with a given name exists, use the isChild() method.
member.returns: Target child node, if it is found; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.isChild(char) const
member.summary: Checks if a child element with a given name exists.
member.returns: true if a child with the provided name exists; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getChildData(char) const
member.summary: Gets the data from the XML child node.
member.param: Type of the child (int, float, vec3, vec4, dvec3, dvec4, ivec3, ivec4, mat4, dmat4, quat, string).
member.returns: The value of the child node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setData(char)
member.summary: Sets an XML data.
member.returns: 1 if the operation was successful; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getData const
member.summary: Gets a data from the XML file.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setDMat4Arg(char,Unigine.Math.dmat4)
member.summary: Sets a value of a given dmat4 argument.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getDMat4Arg(char) const
member.summary: Returns a value of a given dmat4 argument. To check, if an argument exists, use the isArg() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setDMat4Data(Unigine.Math.dmat4)
member.summary: Sets a dmat4 matrix content for the node. This can be done only for nodes with no children.
member.returns: 1 if the content is set successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getDMat4Data const
member.summary: Returns a dmat4 matrix interpretation of data stored in the node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setDoubleArg(char,double)
member.summary: Sets a value of a given double argument.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getDoubleArg(char,double) const
member.summary: Returns a value of a given double argument. To check, if an argument exists, use the isArg() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getDoubleArg(char) const
member.summary: Returns a value of a given double argument. To check, if an argument exists, use the isArg() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setDoubleArrayArg(char,double[])
member.summary: Sets a vector of double as a value of a given argument.
member.param: Reference to a vector with double components.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getDoubleArrayArg(char,outdouble[]) const
member.summary: Returns a set of double values stored in an argument and puts them in a vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setDoubleArrayData(double[])
member.summary: Sets a vector of double components as a content for the node. This can be done only for nodes with no children.
member.param: Reference to a vector with double components.
member.returns: 1 if the content is set successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getDoubleArrayData(outdouble[]) const
member.summary: Returns an interpretation of data stored in the node as a vector of double components.
member.param: Reference to a vector with double components.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setDoubleData(double)
member.summary: Sets a double content for the node. This can be done only for nodes with no children.
member.returns: 1 if the content is set successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getDoubleData const
member.summary: Returns a double interpretation of data stored in the node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setDVec2Arg(char,Unigine.Math.dvec2)
member.summary: Sets a value of a given dvec2 argument.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getDVec2Arg(char) const
member.summary: Returns a value of a given dvec2 argument. To check, if an argument exists, use the isArg() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setDVec2Data(Unigine.Math.dvec2)
member.summary: Sets a dvec2 content for the node. This can be done only for nodes with no children.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getDVec2Data const
member.summary: Returns a dvec2 interpretation of data stored in the node.

member.summary: Sets a value of a given dvec3 argument.

member.summary: Returns a value of a given dvec3 argument. To check, if an argument exists, use the isArg() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setDVec3Data(Unigine.Math.dvec3)
member.summary: Sets a dvec3 content for the node. This can be done only for nodes with no children.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getDVec3Data const
member.summary: Returns a dvec3 interpretation of data stored in the node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setDVec4Arg(char,Unigine.Math.dvec4)
member.summary: Sets a value of a given dvec4 argument.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getDVec4Arg(char) const
member.summary: Returns a value of a given dvec4 argument. To check, if an argument exists, use the isArg() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setDVec4Data(Unigine.Math.dvec4)
member.summary: Sets a dvec4 content for the node. This can be done only for nodes with no children.
member.returns: 1 if the content is set successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getDVec4Data const
member.summary: Returns a dvec4 interpretation of data stored in the node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setFloatArg(char,float)
member.summary: Sets a value of a given float argument.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getFloatArg(char,float) const
member.summary: Returns a value of a given float argument. To check, if an argument exists, use the isArg() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getFloatArg(char) const
member.summary: Returns a value of a given float argument. To check, if an argument exists, use the isArg() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setFloatArrayArg(char,float[])
member.summary: Sets a vector of floats as a value of a given argument.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getFloatArrayArg(char,outfloat[]) const
member.summary: Returns a set of float values stored in an argument and puts them in a vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setFloatArrayData(float[])
member.summary: Sets a vector of floats as a content for the node. This can be done only for nodes with no children.
member.returns: 1 if the content is set successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getFloatArrayData(outfloat[]) const
member.summary: Returns an interpretation of data stored in the node as a vector of floats.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setFloatData(float)
member.summary: Sets a float content for the node. This can be done only for nodes with no children.
member.returns: 1 if the content is set successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getFloatData const
member.summary: Returns a float interpretation of data stored in the node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getFormattedSubTree(char,char) const
member.summary: Converts the specified XML subtree into a formatted string for "pretty printing". If no arguments are passed, the entire XML tree is converted.
member.param: Path to the XML subtree to be formatted. See the description of find() for more details.
String to be used for indenting (e.g. "\t").
member.returns: Multi-line indented output of the specified XML subtree.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setIntArg(char,int,int)
member.summary: Sets a value for a given int argument in a given number notation. By default, the decimal number notation is used.
member.param: Radix to use when setting a value.
member.returns: 1 if the value is set successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getIntArg(char) const
member.summary: Returns a value of a given int argument. To check whether the argument exists, use the isArg() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getIntArg(char,int) const
member.summary: Returns a value of a given int argument. To check, if an argument exists, use the isArg() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setIntArrayArg(char,int[],int)
member.summary: Sets an array of integers as xml argument in a given number notation. By default, the decimal number notation is used.
member.param: Radix to use when setting a value.
member.returns: 1 if the array is set successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getIntArrayArg(char,outint[]) const
member.summary: Returns a set of int values stored in an argument and puts them in a vector.
member.param: Reference to a vector or an array of integers.
member.returns: 1 if values are read successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setIntArrayData(int[],int)
member.summary: Sets a vector of integers as a content for the XML node in a given number notation. By default, the decimal number notation is used. This can be done only for XML nodes with no children.
member.param: Radix to use when setting a value.
member.returns: 1 if the content is set successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getIntArrayData(outint[]) const
member.summary: Returns an interpretation of data stored in the node as a vector of integers.
member.returns: 1 if values are read successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setIntData(int,int)
member.summary: Sets an integer as a content for the XML node in a given number notation. By default, the decimal number notation is used. This can be done only for XML nodes with no children.
member.param: Radix to use when setting a value.
member.returns: 1 if the content is set successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getIntData const
member.summary: Returns an integer interpretation of data stored in the node.

member.summary: Sets a value of a given ivec2 argument.

member.summary: Sets a name of the node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getName const
member.summary: Returns a name of the node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getNumArgs const
member.summary: Returns a number of arguments.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getNumChildren const
member.summary: Returns the number of the node children.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getParent const
member.summary: Returns the parent of the current XML node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setQuatArg(char,Unigine.Math.quat)
member.summary: Sets a value of a given quat argument.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getQuatArg(char) const
member.summary: Returns a value of a given quat argument. To check, if an argument exists, use the isArg() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setQuatData(Unigine.Math.quat)
member.summary: Sets a quaternion content for the node. This can be done only for nodes with no children.
member.returns: 1 if the content is set successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getQuatData const
member.summary: Returns a quaternion interpretation of data stored in the node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setRawData(char)
member.summary: Sets a raw content for the node. Raw data will be automatically formatted as a CDATA section. This can be done only for nodes with no children.
member.returns: 1 if the content is set successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setStringArrayArg(char,Unigine.Vector{String,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
member.summary: Sets a vector of strings as a value of a given argument in a given number notation. By default, the decimal number notation is used.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getStringArrayArg(char,Unigine.Vector{String,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
member.summary: Returns a set of string values stored in an argument and puts them in a vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setStringArrayData(Unigine.Vector{String,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},char)
member.summary: Sets a vector of strings as a content for the node. This can be done only for nodes with no children.
member.param: Reference to a vector of strings.
Character(s) to be used as a delimiter to split tokens.
member.returns: true if the content is set successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getStringArrayData(Unigine.Vector{String,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},char) const
member.summary: Returns an interpretation of data stored in the node as a vector of strings.
member.param: Reference to a vector of strings.
Character(s) to be used as a delimiter to split tokens.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getSubTree(char) const
member.summary: Dumps the node tree.
member.returns: Single-line non-indented output of the node tree. If no arguments are passed, the entire XML tree would be output.

member.summary: Sets a value of a given vec2 argument.

member.summary: Returns a value of a given vec2 argument. To check, if an argument exists, use the isArg() method.

member.summary: Sets a vec2 content for the node. This can be done only for nodes with no children.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getVec2Data const

member.summary: Sets a value of a given vec3 argument.

member.summary: Returns a value of a given vec3 argument. To check, if an argument exists, use the isArg() method.

member.summary: Sets a vec3 content for the node. This can be done only for nodes with no children.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getVec3Data const

member.summary: Sets a value of a given vec4 argument.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getVec4Arg(char) const
member.summary: Returns a value of a given vec4 argument. To check, if an argument exists, use the isArg() method.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setVec4Data(Unigine.Math.vec4)
member.summary: Sets a vec4 content for the node. This can be done only for nodes with no children.
member.returns: 1 if the content is set successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getVec4Data const
member.summary: Returns a vec4 interpretation of data stored in the node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setXmlData(char)
member.summary: Sets an unquoted string to data stored in the node. This string can also contain XML sub-tree with rich text formatting.
member.returns: 1 if the string is set successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.addChild(char,char) const
member.summary: Appends a new XML node to the current XML node as a child.
member.param: Arguments of the XML node. The default value is 0.This value should be passed if the first argument is a string

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.addChild(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Xml}) const
member.summary: Appends a new XML node to the current XML node as a child.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.clear
member.summary: Clears all data associated with the node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.clearChildren
member.summary: Clears all children of the current XML node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.clearUnusedData
member.summary: Clears the unused nodes and arguments.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.copy(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Xml})
member.summary: Copies all data (name, arguments, data, flags and a child hierarchy) from the source XML node to the current one.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.decode(char)
member.summary: Decodes special XML characters (less-than, greater-than, ampersand, double-quote and apostrophe) and numeric character references.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.encode(char)
member.summary: Encodes special XML characters (less-than, greater-than, ampersand, double-quote and apostrophe) to their character entity reference.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.find(char) const
member.summary: Searches for an XML sub-tree.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.findArg(char) const
member.summary: Searches for a XML argument by its name.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.findChild(char) const
member.summary: Searches for the number of the XML node child by name.
member.param: Name of the XML node child.
member.returns: The number of the XML node child if it is exists; otherwise, -1.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.load(char,bool)
member.summary: Loads an XML document and sets the current node to be the root of the parsed tree.
member.param: true to enable automatic skipping of errors (the file will be loaded in any case); false — to disable it (the file will not be loaded in case of any error).
member.returns: true if the file is read and parsed successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.load(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream},size_t,bool,bool)
member.summary: Loads XML data from the specified stream and sets the current node to be the root of the parsed tree.
member.param: Stream from which the data of the XML node is to be loaded.
Size of the data block to be read from the stream, in bytes.
Binary format flag: use true to load data in binary format, or false - to load it in text format.
true to enable automatic skipping of errors (the data will be loaded in any case); false — to disable it (the data will not be loaded in case of any error).
member.returns: true if the data is read and parsed successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.parse(char)
member.summary: Parses a string with XML mark-up and sets the current node to be the root of the parsed tree.
member.returns: true if a string is successfully parsed; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.printUnusedData(char) const
member.summary: Logs warnings of unused data for debugging.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.removeArg(char)
member.summary: Removes the argument with the given name from the list of the current XML node arguments.
member.returns: 1 if the argument is deleted successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.removeChild(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Xml})
member.summary: Removes a child node and its descendants from the current XML node.
member.returns: Removed child node and its descendants, if they are found; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.save(char,bool,char) const
member.summary: Formats the tree of the current node and writes it to the specified file in the specified format. Creates the given file path if it doesn’t exist yet (including subdirectories).
member.param: Binary format flag: use true to save data to a binary file, or false - to save it to a text file.
String to be used for indentation (e.g. "\t").
member.returns: true if the file is written successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.save(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream},bool,char) const
member.summary: Formats the tree of the current node and writes is to the specified stream in the specified format.
member.param: Stream to which the data of the XML node is to be written.
Binary format flag: use true to save data to a binary file, or false - to save it to a text file.
String to be used for indentation (e.g. "\t").
member.returns: true if the file is written successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.symbols(char)
member.summary: Replaces ampersand characters with character entity references.
member.returns: String which contains replaced ampersand characters with character entity references.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.getLoadPath const
member.summary: Returns the path to an XML file from which the data of the XML instance was loaded.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setData(Unigine.UGUID)
member.summary: Sets a UGUID content for the node.
member.returns: true if the content is set successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setData(bool)
member.summary: Sets a boolean content for the node.
member.returns: true if the content is set successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setData(int,int)
member.summary: Sets an integer content in the specified form (binary, octal, decimal, hexadecimal) for the node.
member.param: Radix (base) specifying the form of representation of the value, one of the following:2 - binary8 - octal10 - decimal (default)16 - hexadecimal
member.returns: true if the content is set successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setData(longlong)
member.summary: Sets a long integer content for the node.
member.returns: true if the content is set successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setData(float)
member.summary: Sets a float content for the node.
member.returns: true if the content is set successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setData(double)
member.summary: Sets a double content for the node.
member.returns: true if the content is set successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setData(Unigine.Math.vec2)
member.summary: Sets a vec2 vector content for the node.
member.returns: true if the content is set successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setData(Unigine.Math.vec3)
member.summary: Sets a vec3 vector content for the node.
member.returns: true if the content is set successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Xml.setData(Unigine.Math.vec4)
member.summary: Sets a vec4 vector content for the node.
